name: 神經行為學
description: In this course, we will discuss how different behaviors of different animals are controlled by the nervous system and how different research approaches are designed to study the neural basis of behavior. This course is composed by lectures, paper discussion and student presentation. Students will be asked to lead discussion and write a term paper. The main goal of this course is to lead students to understand the basics of neuroethology and prepare them to read research articles and critical thinking.
goals: 瞭解不同動物的神經系統的行為模式
讓學生學習閱讀文獻以及批判性思考的能力
syllabus:
Introduction

Fundamental of Neurobiology

The neurogenetics of Sociality

Genetics of sexual behaviors in Drosophila

Genetics of aggression in Drosophila

Navigation mechanisms of migrating monarch butterflies

Pain behaviors: scorpion toxin

Olfactory behaviors: toxoplasma

Learning and memory in simple reflex systems in Aplysia

Song learning in songbirds

Spatial learning and memory in rodents

Formation of memory circuit

Olfactory behaviors: epigenetic control

Student Presentation
